business.headline: Paying rent to parents or spouse to save tax? New rules mean think twiceClaiming HRA by paying rent to family members has been a common tax-saving method. Yet, changes expected from April 2026 could make these claims more closely examined than before.

Is redevelopment a safe bet for real estate investors?Redevelopment today is not just about replacing old buildings. It is about creating larger, more valuable assets that align with how people live and work now, closer to transport, offices, and social infrastructure.

IDFC First Bank's Rs 590-crore fraud: What went wrong and how bad is the damage?A fraud this size should never have slipped past routine controls. This article attempts to explain just how sharply the Rs 590-crore fraud impacts IDFC First Bank.

Using Groww, Zerodha or other trading platforms? Here's why DP charges matterMany investors focus on brokerage fees but often miss another cost, i.e., DP charges. Whether you trade on Groww, Zerodha, or similar platforms, knowing these fees can help you avoid surprises.

Infosys, TCS, HCLTech tumble up to 6%: Why are IT stocks down today?A sharp slide in India's biggest tech stocks has once again put the spotlight on global uncertainty and the growing fear that artificial intelligence is reshaping the industry faster than expected.

Sensex plunges 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?By 12:30 PM, the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) Sensex had dropped 1,010.90 points to 82,283.76, while the National Stock Exchange (NSE) of India Nifty50 was down 287.25 points at 25,425.75.

Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade as IT stocks bleed; Infosys down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 722.19 points to 82,572.47, while the NSE Nifty50 plummeted 203.60 points to 25,509.40 as of 10:04 am.

FedEx seeks refund, sues US over Trump's emergency tariff order: ReportFedEx said that it has filed a lawsuit in the US Court of International Trade seeking a refund of tariffs imposed under Trump's emergency powers. The case follows a recent ruling by the US Supreme Court, which found that the tariffs were unlawful.

Paramount raises offer for Warner Bros Discovery amid Netflix threat: ReportThe fresh bid marks another twist in what has become one of the biggest deal battles in the global media industry. Warner Bros Discovery owns some of Hollywood's most recognised titles, including the Harry Potter and Game of Thrones franchises.

Banks can't afford to mis-sell, it is an offence: Nirmala SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said banks cannot treat mis-selling as routine business and called it an offence. Her remarks come as the Reserve Bank of India is preparing to issue guidance aimed at curbing mis-selling practices by banks.

IDFC First Bank says Rs 590 crore fraud due to staff collusionThe issue first came to light when a Haryana government department asked the bank to close its account and transfer funds. During this process, the bank noticed a mismatch between its records and the department's figures. This led to a wider internal review.

EPFO to refund Rs 1,000 or less in inactive accounts: Who is eligible?At present, there are around 31 lakh inoperative EPFO accounts. Out of these, nearly six lakh accounts have Rs 1,000 or less deposited.

Will AI impact your appraisals this year? Here's how much you can expectArtificial intelligence is playing a growing role in shaping compensation models. Around 50 to 60% of large organisations now use data analytics when planning salaries and bonuses.
Sensex, Nifty end after strong rally, but IT stocks limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 479.95 points to end at 83,290.81, while the NSE Nifty50 added 141.75 points to close at 25,713.00.

Claiming HRA for rent to family? What draft tax rules may changeMany salaried employees claim HRA for rent paid to family members. While the practice remains allowed, proposed tax rules may bring an extra layer of scrutiny. Here's what could change.

Should India be concerned about the rise in gold and silver prices?The Finance Minister said gold has always been a favoured investment for Indian households. Demand often rises during festival seasons such as Akshaya Tritiya and other auspicious occasions.

Big housing boost for Gurugram, overtakes Mumbai in 2025 ultra luxury salesGurugram appears to be at the centre of India's ultra-luxury housing story, and the momentum suggests that demand for high-value homes is far from slowing down.

Has RERA lost its bite? What homebuyers need to knowThe Supreme Court has come down hard on real estate regulatory authorities (RERA), saying they should be abolished as they appear to favour builders and have failed to protect homebuyers, which is their intended purpose.

How a fake ITR refund message led to a Rs 1.5 lakh lossIt started with a simple message about a pending tax refund. Within minutes, a taxpayer had lost Rs 1.5 lakh. The case reveals how scammers are exploiting refund anxiety.

Are you saving enough for retirement? Why the Rs 1 crore target is outdatedMany Indians underestimate how fast expenses rise after 60 and how long their savings must last. A new study analyses how inflation, longevity and market risks reshape the real retirement corpus you need.

entertainment.headline: The Bluff review: Priyanka Chopra powers a pirate drama that rarely sets sailRelease Date:Wed Feb 25, 2026 The Bluff places Priyanka Chopra at the centre of a gritty 19th-century Caribbean revenge tale, mixing high-stakes action with raw emotion. While the film looks ambitious and benefits from a commanding lead performance, uneven writing holds it back from truly packing a punch.

Kanguva director Siva confirms fifth collaboration with Ajith Kumar Ajith Kumar recently competed in the Asian Le Mans Series while plans for his next film with director Siva are underway. The collaboration could mark an important comeback for the director after his last film's performance.

Little bit of action, fun, madness, love: Nani announces Sujeeth's film with promo Director Sujeeth officially announced Bloody Romeo on Nani's 41st birthday with an animated promo. The film promises a fresh take on action and dark humour featuring Nani as a chef-gangster.

Anirudh Ravichander to perform ICC anthem at India vs Zimbabwe match in Chennai Singer Anirudh Ravichander will deliver a live performance of the energetic official ICC event song Feel the Thrill at Chepauk on February 26. India will clash with Zimbabwe for their next T20 match.

Kerala lives in harmony: High Court orders screening of The Kerala Story 2 amid row The Kerala High Court has ordered a screening of The Kerala Story 2 amid a row over the film's alleged negative portrayal of the state. Observing that "Kerala lives in harmony," the court said concerns about possible communal tension "cannot be ignored."

Piggy Chops: Priyanka Chopa reveals her nickname to Karl Urban, guess his reaction Priyanka Chopra recalled to Karl Urban how Abhishek Bachchan gave her the nickname Piggy Chops. Read on to know how her co-star of The Bluff reacted.

Netflix announces release of Priyanka Mohan's Made in Korea. Check date Netflix is all set to premiere the Tamil film Made in Korea this March, taking viewers on an enchanting journey from a small town in Tamil Nadu to the vibrant streets of Seoul. The film stars Priyanka Mohan in the lead.

Kalki 2 starts, Amitabh Bachchan and Kamal Haasan reunite after nearly 40 years Amitabh Bachchan and Kamal Haasan reunited after nearly 40 years as Kalki 2 goes on floors. Here's why this collaboration matters.

Is TVF adapting The Pitt for India? Arunabh Kumar breaks silence TVF is reportedly adapting The Pitt for Indian audiences. In an exclusive chat, TVF founder Arunabh Kumar reacted to reports of American medical drama's Indian remake.

Emily in Paris' Lily Collins to play Audrey Hepburn in Breakfast at Tiffany's film Lily Collins will play Audrey Hepburn in a new film that explores the making of the classic Breakfast at Tiffany's. Inspired by Sam Wasson's nonfiction book, the project will uncover lesser-known stories, creative tensions and studio dynamics behind the iconic 1961 romantic comedy.

Hotmail founder Sabeer Bhatia calls Dhurandhar disgusting: Spreads revenge Hotmail founder Sabeer Bhatia has criticised Dhurandhar for its message of revenge and hate. He urged viewers to reject the Ranveer Singh-starrer.

Was Rakul Preet ignored at awards? Fitness influencer Lakshay Jaggi breaks silence A video showing influencer Lakshay Jaggi appearing to ignore actor Rakul Preet Singh at an award ceremony has attracted attention online. Jaggi has now clarified what happened through a statement on social media.

Vicky Kaushal calls Katrina Kaif a warrior mother as he reflects on parenthood Vicky Kaushal shared his admiration for Katrina Kaif's dedication as a mother while discussing his own role as a father to their three-month-old son, Vihaan. He called Kaif a warrior mother, appreciating her resilience.

When and where to watch Boong, the BAFTA-winning Indian film, on OTT Boong, a Manipuri-language feature film, recently won Best Children's and Family Film at the 79th British Academy Film Awards. While the film has earned international recognition, audiences in India are still waiting for its release on streaming platforms.

BLACKPINK teases cosmic new era with GO, third mini album DEADLINE out February 27 Blackpink has released the first teaser for their new title track GO. The teaser hints at a bold, cosmic visual direction and a major cultural collaboration.

Actor Samantha calls herself and Raj Nidimoru an irritating couple. Here's why Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu lightheartedly described herself and Raj Nidimoru as an 'irritating couple'. In an interview, she discussed her dynamic with filmmaker and husband Raj Nidimoru.

Jeff Bezos gives Project Hail Mary lift-off with glowing praise for Ryan Gosling Amazon founder Jeff Bezos has publicly praised Ryan Gosling's performance in Project Hail Mary. What makes the sci-fi epic stand out?

Sudipto Sen on not helming The Kerala Story 2: Can't make film on WhatsApp forwards Filmmaker Sudipto Sen explained why he is not directing The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond. He said that he has chosen not to direct the sequel due to the lack of thorough research and reliance on unverified sources.

Rashmika and Vijay's wedding festivities kick off with pool party, elegant dinner The pre-wedding festivities of actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have begun. It featured a poolside gathering with close friends and a sophisticated candlelit dinner.

He faces charges of criminal conspiracy, voluntarily causing harm to a public servant, obstructing a public servant on duty, and wilful disobedience.

Jharkhand couple killed in air ambulance crash had taken Rs 8 lakh loan for planeIn a desperate attempt to save the life of 41-year-old Sanjay, the family took a loan of 8 lakh from friends and relatives. Sanjay, along with 6 others, died in the air ambulance crash.
Nasa talks. Isro should tooNasa's openness does not prevent criticism, but it builds resilience. When problems are explained clearly, trust grows. Isro needs to quickly understand this.

NEET PG: Zero-percentile doctors are a competency crisis, not a statistical glitchNO! NEET PG cannot be reduced to past qualification. If someone cleared UG but cannot even secure 36% in PG after six years of training, the issue is competency, not vacancies. Read this because when merit filters weaken in medical education, the risk ultimately moves from exam halls to hospital wards.

How India rolled out high-speed rail, metro using common tracksPM Narendra Modi inaugurated both, India's first full RRTS corridor connecting New Delhi and Meerut, and a metro system for the city in western Uttar Pradesh. The shared-track model, with both the services using the same infrastructure, will deliver high-speed regional travel and a seamless urban commute.

In an Instagram video, she listed a series of activities she believed people without sufficient savings should avoid.

Anthropic accuses DeepSeek and 2 other Chinese AI models of stealing its dataAnthropic has accused three Chinese AI firms, including DeepSeek, of distilling data from its Claude chatbot to train and improve their own AI models. How Mexico took down drug lord El Mencho by tracking his girlfriendMexico's Defence Minister Ricardo Trevilla said investigators tracked a close aide connected to one of Oseguera's partners and monitored her movements to a secluded rural compound. When she left, authorities assessed that the cartel chief was still inside under tight security, prompting them to swiftly launch the operation.

sports.headline: Play like Virat Kohli: Tilak Varma gets advice from EX-IND batter amid poor form Former India cricketer Mohammed Kaif has urged Tilak Varma to shut out the noise and stick to his original gameplan of being an anchor in the T20I side. Tilak has struggled for runs during the tournament.

Super Sub Sesko ready to deliver for Manchester United whenever Carrick calls Benjamin Sesko insists he is unfazed by his role under Michael Carrick and is ready to make an impact for Manchester United whenever called upon.

Hope keeps everyone guessing T20 World Cup: West Indies captain Shai Hope remained coy about his spin plans against India when both teams battle it out in the Super 8 stage of the T20 World Cup 2026. PAK vs ENG, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: Pakistan's second Super 8s game against England in Pallekele looks set to avoid the rain that washed out their opener, with forecasts showing just a 2 per cent chance of showers on Tuesday.

The Mumbai youngster speaks about growth, mentorship under Abhishek Nayar, learning alongside Rohit Sharma, and his ambitions for IPL 2026 and beyond.

Ranji Trophy final Day 1 Live: J&K look to pile up runs in 2nd session Karnataka (KAR) vs Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) Live Score, Ranji Trophy final: The 2nd session is underway, and J&K's Yawer Hassan and co will look to pile on the runs in the post-lunch session. The onus is on Karnataka's bowlers to navigate through the tough conditions where there is nothing much on offer for the bowling unit.

Suryakumar at No.3: Irfan Pathan urges batting shake-up for IND vs ZIM T20 World Cup: Irfan Pathan suggested that India captain Suryakumar Yadav should think about coming in at No.3 for India during their clash against Zimbabwe in Chennai. Pathan also said the hosts need Axar Patel back in the lineup but warned against making too many changes.

ENG vs PAK, Super 8 preview: Pakistan out to break England curse in tricky clashT20 World Cup, ENG vs PAK: England will look to seal their semi-final berth when they face Pakistan on Tuesday in Pallekele International Cricket Stadium. Pakistan, who have never beaten England in the tournament's history, face a tough challenge heading into the contest.

World champions India Women resume ODI duties in Alyssa Healy's farewell festivalINDW vs AUSW: Harmanpreet Kaur's India will be taking the field for the first time as the world champions when they meet Australia in the first ODI on Tuesday in Brisbane. Alyssa Healy is also set to play in her last white-ball series for the Aussies.

Shikhar Dhawan slams false narratives about personal life after second marriageShikhar Dhawan has slammed people for circulating false statements about his personal life after his second marriage. Dhawan recently married his girlfriend Sophie Shine in a private ceremony.

T20 World Cup: West Indies add to India's woes with thumping win over ZimbabweWest Indies secured a commanding 107-run victory over Zimbabwe in their Super 8 T20 World Cup match at Mumbai. The victory has intensified the pressure on India, who face a challenging path ahead in the tournament.

How Rashid Khan lent his helping hand for Afghanistan women's teamFirooza Amiri has revealed how Rashid Khan supported the Afghanistan women's team. Recently, Rashid also spoke in their favour during a press conference at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

England in a good place despite not being at their best: Liam Dawson before Pakistan clashT20 World Cup 2026, ENG vs PAK: Speaking to the reporters before the match against Pakistan on Tuesday, Liam Dawson said that England can play much better cricket, but are in good shape after their win against Sri Lanka.

UEFA suspends Benfica's Prestianni for 2nd leg tie with Madrid over alleged racismUEFA has provisionally suspended Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni for Wednesday's Champions League match against Real Madrid following the alleged racist incident involving Vinicius Junior in last week's first leg.

Pakistan will give England a tough time in Super 8s: Sahibzada FarhanT20 World Cup 2026, ENG vs PAK: Speaking to the reporters, Sahibzada Farhan said that Pakistan are not bothered about their winless run against England in the history of the tournament. England wary of Pakistan as a unit, not only spinner Usman Tariq: Liam DawsonEngland spinner Liam Dawson insisted his side will not be distracted by the growing hype around Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq ahead of their crucial T20 World Cup Super 8 clash in Pallekele.

Sahibzada reacts to reports of IPL-owned Hundred teams snubbing Pakistani playersPakistani batter Sahibzada Farhan brushed aside questions related to speculation that players from his country could be ignored by at least four Indian-owned franchises in The Hundred auction, saying the matter was beyond their control.

ZIM vs WI Super 8 Highlights: West Indies hammer Zimbabwe by 107 runs in MumbaiZimbabwe (ZIM) vs West Indies (WI), T20 World Cup Super 8 Highlights: West Indies beat Zimbabwe by 107 runs at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai after Gudakesh Motie picked up four wickets and Shimron Hetmyer played a stupendous knock.

Australia return for Tests in South Africa, 8 years after SandpapergateAustralia are set to tour South Africa for an ODI and Test series in September and October later this year. The Aussies have not played a series in South Africa since the infamous Sandpapergate scandal in 2018.

SA dragged India along the ground and insulted them: Former Pakistan cricketerSouth Africa handed India their first T20 World Cup defeat after 12 wins with a 76-run victory. The loss has raised questions over India's batting strategy and tournament prospects.

New Zealand's Mitchell banks on India's '2nd favourite' tag for semi-final pushNew Zealand all-rounder Daryl Mitchell said his side was ready to embrace their tag as Indian cricket fans' "second favourite team" as they attempt to steer through a demanding Super Eight group and return to the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup.

Who is Vaishnavi Adkar? Pune star becomes India's No.2 with dream run in BengaluruVaishnavi Adkar had a remarkable run at the ITF Women's W100 Open in Bengaluru, finishing as the runner-up. The 21-year-old also rose to become India's No. 2 ranked player following this impressive performance.

South Africa expose India's real problem: Accelerators without Kohli-type engineT20 World Cup: Surya Kumar Yadav smiled at a presser. South Africa had the last laugh. India's World Cup campaign is exposing a structural flaw no amount of aggression can hide.

Cupcake ad deleted, ego eaten: What is Star Sports serving next?T20 World Cup 2026: When the Cupcake promo disappeared after India's humbling defeat to South Africa in Ahmedabad, it symbolised more than embarrassment. The 'cupcake gate' has exposed how arrogance, hype, and disrespect have overtaken thoughtful storytelling in cricket broadcasting.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
